Pre-Game Insights: Georgia host Greece at the Boris Paichadze Dinamo Arena in UEFA Euro 2024 qualifying on Tuesday (March 26).
Georgia finished fourth in Group A and failed to earn a direct qualification but advanced to the playoffs via the Nations League.
Georgia beat Luxembourg 2-0 in the semifinals to book a date with Greece in the final.
Greece thrashed Kazakhstan 5-0 in Path C semifinals and face Georgia in the final for the last ticket to the Euro 2024 finals.
Georgia have recovered from a frustrating losing streak, winning thrice in five games. They are unbeaten at home in four outings across competitions.
Greece have lost thrice in five trips across competitions.
Greece boast seven wins over Georgia in nine meetings, drawing twice.
Napoli star Khvicha Kvaratskhelia carries the hope of his nation, scoring four times for Georgia in the qualifiers.
Georges Mikautadze, who boasts two goals, is another key attacking threat for Georgia.
Olympiacos winger Georgios Masouras is second in his team's goal charts with five goals.
Anastasios Bakasetas has netted thrice for Greece.
